Evidence Statements: - The student can draw what a piece of ice looks like before it is heated.
- The student can illustrate how ice changes to water after heating.
- The student can show how water can change back into ice when cooled.
- The student can demonstrate that this change (ice to water and back to ice) is reversible.
- The student can include labels to indicate the process of heating and cooling in their drawing.
- The student can connect their drawing to the concept that some changes can be reversed and some cannot.
